early.description: Born on a planet facing ecological disaster, your earliest memories are of barren landscapes and toxic skies.
At age eight, you helped your family build makeshift shelters against harsh environmental conditions.
You learned to purify water using rudimentary methods, showcasing your ingenuity.
An encounter with environmental hazards taught you the importance of caution and preparation.
You developed a knack for finding edible plants and resources in a dying ecosystem.
Witnessing the collapse of local wildlife instilled in you a deep understanding of ecological balance.
You customized protective gear from scavenged materials, demonstrating resourcefulness.
An elder taught you survival techniques essential for harsh environments.
You formed a bond with another child survivor, sharing knowledge and resources.
A close call with a toxic storm sharpened your instincts and physical resilience.
You began studying old texts on ecology and technology, expanding your understanding.
An illness due to environmental toxins tested your endurance and willpower.
You discovered a hidden cache of supplies, improving your community's situation.
A family member fell ill from pollution, prompting you to seek remedies.
You started experimenting with sustainable practices to combat environmental decline.
An encounter with corporate agents exploiting resources sparked your distrust.
You developed physical strength through constant labor to survive in harsh conditions.

mid.description: You led a group to a safer area, showcasing leadership and strategic planning.
A conflict with another group over resources tested your combat skills and ethics.
You devised a method to generate clean energy, earning respect from peers.
An opportunity to evacuate arose, challenging your trust in corporate promises.
You began mentoring younger refugees, teaching survival and adaptation techniques.
A personal loss due to environmental collapse made you question your path.
You discovered evidence of corporate negligence causing the disaster.
A romantic relationship complicated your survival priorities.
You faced ethical choices when resources were scarce.
An injury forced you to adapt your methods, relying more on intelligence.

late.description: Elevated to a leadership role, you coordinated efforts to rebuild and adapt.
A major disaster threatened your group's survival, requiring decisive action.
You uncovered a plan that could restore some of the environment, prompting difficult choices.
Faced with a moral dilemma, you had to choose between corporate aid and autonomy.
An opportunity to join a movement advocating for environmental restoration challenged your priorities.
You exposed corporate exploitation of refugees, preventing further harm.
A personal tragedy prompted deep reflection on your life's purpose.
You began to suffer from health issues due to prolonged exposure to toxins.
A movement to relocate to a new world gained momentum, and you had to decide your role.
You mentored a young refugee, hoping to pass on your knowledge and values.
Conditions worsened, making survival increasingly challenging.
You authored a comprehensive guide on surviving environmental collapse.
An external threat, such as hostile groups or natural disasters, endangered your community.
You faced a critical decision when offered a chance to work with a corporation for mutual benefit.
An unexpected alliance offered new possibilities but also new risks.
You considered the legacy you would leave and how to effect lasting environmental change.
A technological advancement provided hope for restoration, challenging you to adapt.
